findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of certain variables without checking if their current state is the same as the one given as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: FSA - Fixed Swap Address
findings.description: The swap address is assigned once and cannot be changed, which may prevent the contract from migrating to a new liquidity pool pair or decentralized exchange.

findings.title: RVD - Redundant Variable Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares and initializes the `_buyCooldown` and `_liquidityFee` variables at zero. Adding or subtracting zero from any value does not impact the result of the operation in any way.

findings.title: MVN - Misleading Variables Naming
findings.description: Variables can have misleading names if their names do not accurately reflect the value they contain or the purpose they serve.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure the value of the state variable cannot be changed after it has been set, which decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide, which can lead to decreased readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L17 - Usage of Solidity Assembly
findings.description: Using assembly can be error-prone and may contain errors such as Syntax, Type, Out-of-bounds, Stack, and Revert. It's important to carefully test and debug assembly code.

findings.title: L19 - Stable Compiler Version
findings.description: The `^` symbol indicates that any version of Solidity that is compatible with the specified version can be used to compile the contract. The version lock is a mechanism that allows the author to specify a minimum version of the Solidity compiler that must be used to compile the contract code.

findings.title: Renounced Ownership
findings.description: The contract's ownership has been renounced.
